Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2013 12:41AM - edited Dec 19, 2013 12:42AM by Redmond I know the study you are referring to.  There is  a town about 4 hours north of me where they are doing the study.  I called and found out that it is randomized.  I wanted the surgery as I would never forgive myself if I did not do everything within my power to defeat this enemy.  Thus I declined to participate.  I asked if it were difficult to get people into the study to which they replied ...well...it is the only  way to have surgery.  I have been very fortunate and have responded favorably to chemo.  So much so that initially they suggested that surgery was not an option... but now after a year of treatment... I had the surgery Nov 19.  I am glad that I did although I'm still fairly sore (they did reconstruction at the same time).  My pathology was negative.  You could argue that the surgery was not needed as the pathology was negative but...the only way to know is to have the surgery.   I will have a scan in Jan to see how the lung mets are doing.
Posts.Title: Surgery or not? Please help del3 Redmond
